text: The 1957 Washington State Cougars football team was an American football team that represented Washington State College during the 1957 NCAA University Division football season. Led by second-year head coach Jim Sutherland, the team posted a 6–4 overall record, and were 5–3 in the Pacific Coast Conference. ==Schedule== ==NFL Draft== Four Cougars were selected in the 1958 NFL Draft, which was thirty rounds (360 selections). {| class=wikitable style="text-align:center" |- |Bob Newman |Back |2 |22 |San Francisco 49ers |- |Bill Steiger |End |22 |259 |Los Angeles Rams |- |Dan Verhey |Tackle |23 |276 |Cleveland Browns |- |Dave Crowell |Guard |28 |326 |Green Bay Packers |} : * List of Washington State Cougars in the NFL Draft ==References== ==External links== *Game program: California at WSC – September 28, 1957 *Game program: Oregon at WSC – October 19, 1957 *Game program: UCLA vs. WSC at Spokane – November 9, 1957 *Game program: Idaho at WSC – November 16, 1957 Washington State Cougars Category:Washington State Cougars football seasons Washington State Cougars
title: 1957 Washington State Cougars football team
